title: Pentagon demands access to Anthropic AI technology
desc: The Pentagon is demanding access to Anthropic’s AI technology, threatening to invoke the Defense Production Act if the company doesn’t comply.

title: Trial for men accused of perverting justice in Alan Hall case further delayed
desc: A four-week trial was scheduled to start on Monday, when the court heard one defendant was too ill to attend.

title: Meridian warns households could face power bill increases up to seven percent
desc: Meridian CEO Mike Roan said "unfortunately" some cost increases would be passed through to households again this year.

title: URA releases two prime condo sites at Holland Plain, River Valley for sale
desc: Both are Core Central Region parcels, with the Morrison Lane site being offered from the reserve list of state land sales programme

title: Trump tells US men’s hockey goalie he’s receiving Presidential Medal of Freedom - joining select few athletes to receive the honor
desc: Trump made the stunning announcement about Connor Hellebuyck after marching the Olympic gold medal-winning team into the Capitol during his State of the Union address

title: Bank fails in bid to recover RM400mil loan from 30 parties
desc: High Court says BPMB has no locus standi to sue the alleged recipients of funds from the loan given to a telecommunications company.

title: 'I Am Part of the Solution' unveiled amidst escalating GBV
desc: The Botswana Police Service (BPS) has resolved to intensify its fight against Gender-Based Violence (GBV) and child-related offences through a new community-driven initiative dubbed 'I Am Part of the Solution'.

title: Pentagon Gives Anthropic an Ultimatum Over the Company’s A.I. Model
desc: Anthropic insists on limits on how its technology is used and could be labeled a supply chain risk if it fails to accept the military’s demands.

title: How Lucian Despoiu Influenced Prabowo's Policies
desc: Lucian Despoiu provides political advice to Prabowo Subianto and several ministers. His network is extensive

title: No more excuses on Zanzibar power cuts
desc: Frequent outages erode business confidence, destroy perishable goods, and undermine livelihoods. Small traders, fishermen, and service providers bear the heaviest burden.
